answers.feedback_html: The sign convention for focal length is incorrect.
The calculated focal length is correct.
The radius of curvature is not equal to focal length.

stem_html: A concave mirror has a radius of curvature of 0.8\,\text{m}. What is the focal length of the mirror?

answers.content_html: It gives a wide range of view. The image appears to be closer than the actual object.
answers.feedback_html: A diverging mirror forms images that make the actual object appear farther away than it is.

answers.content_html: It gives a narrow range of view. The image appears to be farther than the actual object.
answers.feedback_html: A wide-range view is obtained by diverging mirrors.

answers.content_html: It gives a narrow range of view. The image appears to be closer than the actual object.
answers.feedback_html: The image formed by a diverging mirror has a wider range, but appears farther than the actual object.

answers.content_html: It gives a wide range of view. The image appears to be farther than the actual object.
answers.feedback_html: Images formed by a diverging mirror appear farther from the mirror than the actual object.

stem_html: Why are diverging mirrors often used for rear-view mirrors in vehicles? What is the main disadvantage of using such a mirror compared with a flat one?

answers.content_html: Light passing through air is partially reflected and refracted when it meets a glass surface. It is reflected because glass has a smooth surface; it is refracted while passing into the transparent glass.
answers.feedback_html: The light is partially reflected by the glass surface and it is refracted while passing through the glass because of the difference in the refractive indices of glass and air.

answers.content_html: Light passing through air is partially reflected and refracted when it meets a glass surface. It is reflected because glass has a rough surface, and it is refracted while passing into the opaque glass.
answers.feedback_html: Light is reflected from glass because it has a smooth surface.

answers.content_html: Light passing through air is partially reflected and refracted when it meets a glass surface. It is reflected because glass has a smooth surface; it is refracted while passing into the opaque glass.
answers.feedback_html: Glass is normally a transparent material.

answers.content_html: Light passing through air is partially reflected and refracted when it meets a glass surface. It is reflected because glass has a rough surface; it is refracted while passing into the transparent glass.
answers.feedback_html: The smooth surface of glass reflects light.

stem_html: Sometimes light may be both reflected and refracted as it meets the surface of a different medium. Identify a material with a surface that when light travels through the air it is both reflected and refracted. Explain how this is possible.
